Project Configuration: Registry Settings

Send comments on this topic.
Whenever a new FlashFX project is created for Windows CE, a default flashfx.reg file is placed in the Project Directory. This file must be modified and the contents pasted into the project.reg file for the CE project.

The flashfx.reg file contains a number of configuration settings which supersede settings which may be specified in ffxconf.h, as discussed in the preceding "FlashFX Configuration Settings" section.

The key aspects of FlashFX configuration which are specified in the flashfx.reg file are: 

        +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
        |                                                                             |
        |  [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Drivers\BuiltIn\FlashFX]                               |
        |      "DLL"="FlashFX.DLL"                                                    |
        |      "Prefix"="DSK"                                                         |
        |      "Order"=dword:1                                                        |
        |      "Index"=dword:1                                                        |
        |      "DeviceNum"=dword:0                                                    |
        |      "DiskNum"=dword:0                                                      |
        |      "DiskFlags"=dword:0                                                    |
        |      "Start"=dword:Change Me                                                |
        |      "Length"=dword:Change Me                                               |
        |      "Format"=dword:0                                                       |
        |      "IClass"="{A4E7EDDA-E575-4252-9D6B-4195D48BB865}"                      |
        |      "ProfileName"="FlashFXDisk1Profile"                                    |
        |                                                                             |
        |  [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\StorageManager\Profiles\FlashFXDisk1Profile]    |
        |      "AutoMount"=dword:1                                                    |
        |      "AutoPart"=dword:0                                                     |
        |      "AutoFormat"=dword:0                                                   |
        |      "MountFlags"=dword:2                                                   |
        |      "Name"="Datalight FlashFX"                                             |
        |      "Folder"="FlashFX Disk"                                                |
        |      "DefaultFileSystem"="FATFS"                                            |
        |      "PartitionDriver"="mspart.dll"                                         |
        |                                                                             |
        |  [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\TxtShell\Extensions]                |
        |      "DatalightShell"="dlshellext.dll"                                      |
        |      "FlashFXShell"="fxshellext.dll"                                        |
        |                                                                             |
        +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+

The following items are critical:

  • Order
    		• - Specifies the load order. This is generally configured to be the same as the Index value.
  • Index
    		• - The Disk Index number, relative to 1. Index 1 will be CE store DSK1: and FlashFX Disk0. Index 2 will be CE store DSK2: and FlashFX Disk1, etc.
  • DeviceNum
    		• - This is the FlashFX Device upon which the Disk will be created. The definition for this setting is identical to that of the DeviceNum field in the FFX_DISK0_SETTINGS settings.
  • DiskNum
    		• - This is the FlashFX Disk number to use. At this time, this value must be equal to the Index value minus 1.
  • DiskFlags
    		• - This specifies the flags to use for the Disk. Bit 0, which is the same as FFX_DISK_RAW, indicates that a raw Disk mapping is to be done. This is not a normal use case. Bit 1, which is the same as FFX_DISK_SPANDEVICES, indicates that the Disk is allowed to span similar Devices. The definition for this setting is identical to that of the Flags field in the FFX_DISK0_SETTINGS settings.
  • Start
    		• - This is the starting offset of the Disk into the Device, in kilobytes. The definition for this setting is identical to that of the OffsetKB field in the FFX_DISK0_SETTINGS settings. If this value is 0xFFFFFFFF, FlashFX will automatically calculate the value such that the Disk starts immediately following the preceding Disk (or in the case of the DISK0, it will start at the beginning of the Device.
  • Length
    		• - This is the length of the Disk, in kilobytes. The definition for this setting is identical to that of the LengthKB field in the FFX_DISK0_SETTINGS settings.
  • Format
    		• - This is a value of 0, 1, or 2, to auto-format the Disk, never, as needed, or always, respectively. The definition for this setting is identical to that of the FormatState field in the FFX_DISK0_FORMAT settings. Typically this value is always 0 for the System Disk, and always 1 for the other Disks.
